properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This message is being issued for Towaninny South and surrounds.

  • This Community Information replaces the Community Information issued at 2.23pm on Sunday, 9 November 2025.
  • There is a hay shed fire on McNicols Road, Towaninny South.
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby roads and communities. 
  • This fire is being monitored. 
  • If you live in the area, close windows and doors to prevent the smell of smoke entering your home. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.   

Health information: 
  • If you need medical advice for exposure to smoke, seek medical advice or call Nurse on Call on 1300 606 024. 
  • Anyone experiencing wheezing, chest tightness and difficulty breathing should call Triple Zero (000).     
Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact the National Relay Service and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - STRUCTURE FIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: McNicols Road, Towaninny South
Issue Date: Monday 10 November 2025, 01:27 pm
Next Update: Thursday 13 November 2025, 02:20 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38387/moreinfo

This message is being issued for Towaninny South and surrounds.

- This Community Information replaces the Community Information issued at 2.23pm on Sunday, 9 November 2025.
- There is a hay shed fire on McNicols Road, Towaninny South.
- Smoke will be visible from nearby roads and communities. 
- This fire is being monitored.  
- If you live in the area, close windows and doors to prevent the smell of smoke entering your home. 


        There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Minor Flood Warning Update is being issued for Bunyip River downstream of Iona.

Minor Flooding has peaked on the Bunyip River overnight. Water levels peaked at 2.1 metres for Iona, and 3.66 metres for Cora Lynn.

  • The Bunyip River catchment has recorded rainfall averaging about 11 mm since 09:00 AM Tuesday 11 November 2025. 
  • The Western Port catchment has recorded rainfall averaging about 6 mm for the same period. 
  • Rainfall totals of less than 1 mm are forecast for the catchment Wednesday 12 November 2025. 
  • Water levels of the Bunyip River at various locations have risen. 
  • Tarago River: The level of Tarago Reservoir is currently at 157.01 metres, below the spillway level of 157.92 metres. 
  • Minor flooding in the Bunyip River catchment is expected to affect low-lying areas adjacent to the waterway. 
  • The ford at Cora Lynn will remain closed to traffic today.
Bunyip River downstream of Iona

The level of the Bunyip River at Cora Lynn is currently at 3.52 metres, exceeding the Minor Flood Level (3.10 metres), and falling. It is likely to fall below the Minor Flood Level (3.10 meters) overnight.
Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.
What you should do: 
  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
  • Monitor weather forecasts and river levels. Go to www.bom.gov.au/vic/warnings/. 
  • Floodwater is dangerous - never drive, walk or ride through floodwater. 
  • Floodwater is toxic - never play or swim in floodwater. 
  • Be wary of river edges, they may subside. 
  • Canoeists should avoid all flood waters; debris and fence lines will become hazardous. 
  • Farmers should ensure that all stock is secure and able to move to higher ground. 
  • Pumps and farm machinery may need to be relocated. 
  • Do not drive across river fords.
Impacts in your area: 
  • High river levels and potential flooding in areas close to rivers and streams.
  • Some bicycle and walking tracks will be unpassable at this level. 
  • The ford at Cora Lynn will be closed to traffic this morning.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 13/11/2025 11:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
  • For road closure information go to https://traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/ or phone 13 11 70.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact the National Relay Service and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

ADVICE - RIVERINE FLOOD - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Bunyip River downstream of Iona
Issue Date: Wednesday 12 November 2025, 11:37 am
Next Update: Thursday 13 November 2025, 11:00 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38405/moreinfo

This Minor Flood Warning Update is being issued for Bunyip River downstream of Iona.

Minor Flooding has peaked on the Bunyip River overnight. Water levels peaked at 2.1 metres for Iona, and 3.66 metres for Cora Lynn. 

- The Bunyip River catchment has recorded rainfall averaging about 11 mm since 09:00 AM Tuesday 11 November 2025. 
- The Western Port catchment has recorded rainfall averaging about 6 mm for the same period. 
- Rainfall totals of less than 1 mm are forecast for the catchment Wednesday 12 November 2025. 
- Water levels of the Bunyip River at various locations have risen. 
- Tarago River: The level of Tarago Reservoir is currently at 157.01 metres, below the spillway level of 157.92 metres. 
- Minor flooding in the Bunyip River catchment is expected to affect low-lying areas adjacent to the waterway. 
- The ford at Cora Lynn will remain closed to traffic today. 

Bunyip River downstream of Iona

The level of the Bunyip River at Cora Lynn is currently at 3.52 metres, exceeding the Minor Flood Level (3.10 metres), and falling. It is likely to fall below the Minor Flood Level (3.10 meters) overnight. 

Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Porepunkah and surrounding areas including Myrtleford and Bright
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for the incident at Porepunkah and surrounding areas including Myrtleford and Bright.
  • Victoria Police advises the search for armed offender Desmond Freeman (Filby) continues.
  • Mount Buffalo National Park fully reopened to the public on Friday 24 October.
  • People in the area should remain vigilant and report any suspicious behaviour to Triple Zero (000) or Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000. 
This Community Information replaces the message issued on Monday 3 November.
If you see Desmond Freeman (Filby), call Triple Zero (000) immediately and do not approach the offender. 
What you should do:
  • If you are in the Porepunkah area, you must follow instructions of emergency services at the scene.
  • Anyone who witnessed the incident or has any information is asked to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or www.crimestoppers.com.au.
Impacts in your area:
  • Road closures may change at short notice. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website for updates on road closures: traffic.transport.vic.gov.au.
This message was issued by Victoria Police.

The next update is expected by 25/11/2025 05:00 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency app
  • VicEmergency Facebook or Twitter
  • Victoria Police Facebook or Twitter
  • For more information, visit: Victoria Police - Porepunkah incident
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment, contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - DANGEROUS PERSON - Remain Vigilant
Incident Location: Porepunkah and surrounding areas including Myrtleford and Bright
Issue Date: Monday 10 November 2025, 04:11 pm
Next Update: Tuesday 25 November 2025, 05:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38386/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for the incident at Porepunkah and surrounding areas including Myrtleford and Bright.
- Victoria Police advises the search for armed offender Desmond Freeman (Filby) continues.
- Mount Buffalo National Park fully reopened to the public on Friday 24 October.
- People in the area should remain vigilant and report any suspicious behaviour to Triple Zero (000) or Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000. 
This Community Information replaces the message issued on Monday 3 November.

If you see Desmond Freeman (Filby), call Triple Zero (000) immediately and do not approach the offender.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Minor Flood Warning Update is being issued for Bunyip River to Iona.

Minor Flooding has peaked on the Bunyip River overnight. Water levels peaked at 2.1 metres for Iona, and 3.66 metres for Cora Lynn.

  • The Bunyip River catchment has recorded rainfall averaging about 11 mm since 09:00 AM Tuesday 11 November 2025.

  • Minor flooding in the Bunyip River catchment is expected to affect low-lying areas adjacent to the waterway.
  • The ford at Cora Lynn will remain closed to traffic today.
Bunyip River to Iona

The level of the Bunyip River at Iona is currently at 1.95 metres, below the Minor Flood Level (2.10 metres), and falling.

This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 11:04am Wednesday 12 November. 
Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.

  • Do not drive across river fords.
Impacts in your area: 
  • High river levels and potential flooding in areas close to rivers and streams.
  • Some bicycle and walking tracks will be unpassable at this level.
  • The ford at Cora Lynn will remain closed to traffic today.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.
